channel.title: Connection Problems
channel.description: I was told to change the ip of my server once to 127.0.0.1 i did then made another copy and made it my no ip. They could connect but it was like there own server.Am i suppose to change the 127.0.0.1 to my no-ip? BTW i did portfoward.

item.title: Connection Problems
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

jedimatt84:

I was told to change the ip of my server once to 127.0.0.1 i did then made another copy and made it my no ip. They could connect but it was like there own server.Am i suppose to change the 127.0.0.1 to my no-ip? BTW i did portfoward.

Yes you have to change the 127.0.0.1 to your no-ip that you portfowarded on.

Read full topic
